articles.author: Dominique Vidalon, Elizabeth Pineau
articles.description: Vandals targeted France's high-speed train network with a series of coordinated actions that brought major disruption to some of the country's busiest rail lines ahead of the Paris Olympics opening ceremony on Friday.
articles.title: Arsonists attack French railways hours before Olympic ceremony

articles.author: Tom Balmforth
articles.description: Russia has begun including new, cheaply-made drones in its long-range attacks on Ukraine, to try to identify air defences, film any damage and act as decoys, a Ukrainian military spy official said.
articles.title: Exclusive: Russia deploys cheap drones to locate Ukraine's air defences

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Typhoon Gaemi lashed towns on China's coastal Fujian province on Friday with heavy rains and strong winds as the most powerful storm to hit the country this year began its widely watched trek into the populous interior.
articles.title: Typhoon Gaemi lashes southeast China after pounding Taiwan, flooding Philippines

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Alleged Mexican kingpin Ismael El Mayo Zambada has pleaded not guilty to U.S. drug trafficking charges, court records showed on Friday, after he and a son of another drug lord were arrested on Thursday in El Paso, Texas.
articles.title: Mexican drug kingpin Ismael 'El Mayo' Zambada pleads not guilty to US charges

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli troops battled Palestinian fighters in Khan Younis in southern Gaza and destroyed tunnels and other infrastructure, as they sought to suppress small militant units that have continued to hit troops with mortar fire, the military said on Friday.
articles.title: Israeli troops battle Palestinian fighters in Gaza city of Khan Younis

articles.author: Maria Cardona, Patricia Zengerle
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu visited former U.S. President Donald Trump at Trump's Florida resort on Friday for a meeting that could ease tensions between two leaders who forged a close alliance during Trump's years in the White House.
articles.title: Netanyahu meets Trump for talks seeking to ease tensions

articles.author: Deisy Buitrago, Mayela Armas, Julia Cobb
articles.description: Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado and her coalition's candidate Edmundo Gonzalez have commanded enthusiastic crowds during their campaign to unseat President Nicolas Maduro and end 25 years of ruling party dominance.
articles.title: Venezuela opposition seeks to end 25 years of socialist power in Sunday vote

articles.author: Md. Zami
articles.description: Md. Rakibul Ahsan was finishing a logo he had designed for a foreign client as the deadline fast approached. Just before he could hit send, Bangladesh's internet was shut down, stranding him and the rest of the country offline.
articles.title: Bangladesh's internet shutdown isolates citizens, disrupts business

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The European Union will transfer 1.5 billion euros in proceeds from frozen Russian assets to Ukraine, European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said on social media platform X on Friday.
articles.title: EU transfers 1.5 billion euros from frozen Russian assets to Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. Ambassador to Mexico Ken Salazar said on Friday that the arrests of Mexican drug kingpin Ismael "El Mayo" Zambada and a son of his former partner, Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman, were a "direct strike" in efforts to combat transnational crime groups.
articles.title: Arrest of drug leaders 'direct strike' against cartels - US Ambassador to Mexico
